channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Is your Python as good as your Perl? Perl/Python role in London
item.description: Our client is at the pinnacle of the premium native advertising game for corporate, tech, financial services, and lifestyle technology. This role is for a Senior Developer who is equally comfortable with Perl AND Python.

item.title: Senior Perl Developer with Cross-Trained Chops. UK Remote Perl Role
item.description: Sure, you’ve got Perl chops for days, but that’s not all you can do — and that’s why our client wants to meet you. They’re looking for senior Perl developers, Node engineers, and those with mighty Python and SQL skills to lead their team. Cross-trained team members are their sweet spot, and whether you’re cross-trained yourself or are open to the possibility, this may be your perfect role.

item.title: Perl developers throw a mean party! Remote Perl role in UK and EU
item.description: Client is particularly keen on someone who knows Modern Perl, but’s also comfortable doing sysadmin tasks. It’s a small and engaged team, and a combination of both would be useful – bonus points if the sysadmin experience is on FreeBSD. They also use some interesting supporting technologies: Elixir, CouchDB, and RabbitMQ, and either experience or enthusiasm for those would go down well.

item.title: NLP is all right by me! Perl, Python, NLP role in Amsterdam
item.description: A global leader in machine intelligence matching job seekers with their perfect career: our client’s goal is human level parsing. They’re on the hunt for an NLP Engineer whose passion for NLP is matched only by their interest in Machine Intelligence and their ability to drive quality improvements, measurement standards, and error analysis processes for the NLP framework.

item.title: Thought-Leader Wanted. Chief Software Architect role in Malaysia (or remote)
item.description: As Chief Software Architect for an international company providing online trading services, you’ll work closely with the Chief Technology Officer. With a strong understanding of the full stack of software development and cloud technologies, you’ll mentor engineering teams and provide guidance in solving technical issues.

item.title: Charlotte PM Richard Hipp Talks About All Things SQLite
item.description: Wednesday, May 25, 2022; 06:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

item.title: Boston Perl Mongers - using Perl's Twitter::API
item.description: Tuesday May 10th, 2021 07:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

item.title: Charlotte PM - Semantically-Friendly DB Searches - D Ruth Holloway (and maybe more)
item.description: Wednesday, May 4, 2022; 06:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great CPAN modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: PWC 161 › Pangrams
item.description: Welcome back to blogging for the weekly challenge. The clarity and simplicity is your USP. Keep it up great work.

item.title: PWC 161 › Abecedarian Words
item.description: I simply love the poetic style coding. You get to learn so much by just reading such code. Thank you for sharing.

item.title: Words and More Words
item.description: A very nice hacky solution this week, I loved it. Thank you for your support and contribution.

item.title: Abecedarian words and pangrams
item.description: A very interesting discussion about the maths behind the task. Always fun to read the blog. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 161
item.description: I am totally blown away by the Perl solution to the task 'Pangrams'. How did you manage to come up with such complex logic. Well done.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 161: words
item.description: Luca has been sharing PostgreSQL solution for sometime now. It is always fun to read it alongwith Raku solutions. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Abecedarian Words and Pangrams
item.description: Laurent blog is very special where you get Perl and Raku solution together. It makes it so easy to follow. Keep it up great work.

item.title: PWC161 - Pangrams
item.description: Not so luck for the task 'Pangrams'. Better luck next time, Ryan Thompson. A very thorough solution in Perl, I must admit. Keep it up great work.

item.title: PWC161 - Abecedarian Words
item.description: No question as far as the task 'Abecedarian Words' is concerned. Mission accomplished. Enjoy Perl and Raku solutions. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge 161
item.description: I am not surprised James dealing with bonus challenge. Highly recommended.

item.title: The Lazy Dog Had It Coming
item.description: Dave's blog introduction is never to be missed. Thanks for your support and contributions.

item.title: Pangram challenge: greed and Scrabble
item.description: Detailed task analysis in a blog form for the first time by Athanasius. Thanks for your contribution.

item.title: Panabecedarian Grams with Raku
item.description: As expected, we got catchy one-liner in Raku by Arne. Well documented solutions, keep it up great work.

item.title: Are Abecedarians from Abecedaria?
item.description: Perl one-liner to find Abecedarian word is very special, you must take a look. Thanks for your contribution.

item.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 157
item.description: Perl Solutions Review by Colin Crain.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 161
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Abecedarian Words" and "Pangrams" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 162
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "ISBN-13" and "Wheatstone-Playfair". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: Perl Web Frameworks
item.description: Covering CGI - Mojolicious - Interchange - Dancer - Catalyst

item.title: Perl Orientado a Objeto Part III
Perl Orientado a Objeto Part II
Perl Orientado a Objeto Part I
QRate
item.description: Flavio is working on QRate, a tool to backup stuff as QR codes in a PDF that can be printed.

item.title: Software Job Search 2022 Retrospective: Coding Challenges
item.description: While this is nothing to do specifically with Perl Dave is very well known in the Perl community and his posts are always very interesting. This is no exception. It is interesting to follow his process of looking for a new job.

item.title: Early bird discount expires 30th April for The Perl and Raku Conf 2022
#561 - Switching to Sendgrid
item.description:
Hi there

I have just switched from using Mailman to Sendgrid to distribute the Perl Weekly. I hope this will improve the delivery rate. I was wondering what system should I use to maintain the list of registered people and got to the conclusion that, at least for the time being I'll use a flat file and I'll manually maintain it. We'll see how that works.

In other news, my son started his own start-up company. He and his partner are building a tool for private investors so instead of chasing data sources they can spend more of their time on the decision making process. It would be nice of you if you checked out their site called torto.ai. If would give a huge boost to them and would help them find investors if you also subscribed to their system. You could also use the code perlweeklyApr20 which gives 20% off all plans until 1st of May.

Enjoy your week!
